t: Jeremiah 14
Sword, Famine, and Pestilence
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah concerning the droughts.
“Judah*pn mourns, And*ld her gates languish; They*ld mourn for the land, And*ld the cry of Jerusalem has gone up.

Their*ld nobles have sent their lads for water; They*ld went to the cisterns and*i found no water. They*ld returned with their vessels empty; They*ld were ashamed and confounded And*ld covered their heads.
Because*ld the ground is parched, For*ld there was no rain in the land, The*ld plowmen were ashamed; They*ld covered their heads.
Yes,*ld the deer also gave birth in the field, But*ld left because there was no grass.
And*ld the wild donkeys stood in the desolate heights; They*ld sniffed at the wind like jackals; Their*ld eyes failed because there*i was*i no grass.”
O*ln Lord,*s though our iniquities testify against us, Do*ld it for Your name’s sake; For*ld our backslidings are many, We*ld have sinned against You.
O*ld the Hope of Israel, his Savior in time of trouble, Why*ld should You be like a stranger in the land, And*ld like a traveler who*i turns aside to tarry for a night?
Why*ld should You be like a man astonished, Like*ld a mighty one who*i cannot save? Yet*ld You, O Lord,*s are*i in our midst, And*ld we are called by Your name; Do*ld not leave us!

Thus*p says the Lord*s to this people: “Thus*pn they have loved to wander; They*ld have not restrained their feet. Therefore*ld the Lord*s does not accept them; He*ld will remember their iniquity now, And*ld punish their sins.”
Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Do not pray for this people, for their*i good.
When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. But I will consume them by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.”
Then*p I said, “Ah, Lord God!*s Behold, the prophets say to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, nor shall you have famine, but I will give you assured peace in this place.’”

And*p the Lord*s said to me, “The prophets prophesy lies in My name. I have not sent them, commanded them, nor spoken to them; they prophesy to you a false vision, divination, a worthless thing, and the deceit of their heart.

Therefore thus says the Lord*s concerning the prophets who prophesy in My name, whom I did not send, and who say, ‘Sword and famine shall not be in this land’—‘By sword and famine those prophets shall be consumed!

And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; they will have no one to bury them—them nor their wives, their sons nor their daughters—for I will pour their wickedness on them.’

“Therefore*p you shall say this word to them: ‘Let*pn my eyes flow with tears night and day, And*ld let them not cease; For*ld the virgin daughter of my people Has*ld been broken with a mighty stroke, with a very severe blow.

If*ld I go out to the field, Then*ld behold, those slain with the sword! And*ld if I enter the city, Then*ld behold, those sick from famine! Yes,*ld both prophet and priest go about in a land they do not know.’”
The People Plead for Mercy

Have*pn You utterly rejected Judah? Has*ld Your soul loathed Zion? Why*ld have You stricken us so that there*i is*i no healing for us? We*ld looked for peace, but there*i was*i no good; And*ld for the time of healing, and there was trouble.
We*ld acknowledge, O Lord,*s our wickedness And*ild the iniquity of our fathers, For*ld we have sinned against You.
Do*ld not abhor us,*i for Your name’s sake; Do*ld not disgrace the throne of Your glory. Remember,*ld do not break Your covenant with us.

Are*ld there any among the idols of the nations that can cause rain? Or*ld can the heavens give showers? Are*ild You not He, O Lord*s our God? Therefore*ld we will wait for You, Since*ld You have made all these.
